timeline.message: [JENKINS-61479] Fix a bug in FingerprintCleanupThread and add tests.

timeline.body:
Is there a race condition here where the cleanup thread may not yet have completed the deletion of the fingerprint file?

Also, is it worth considering using a hamcrest assertion rather than assertTrue?

```suggestion
        assertThat(fpFile.toFile()., is(aReadableFile()));
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Is there a race condition here where the cleanup thread may not yet have completed the deletion of the fingerprint file?

Also, is it worth considering using a hamcrest assertion rather than assertTrue?

Suggested change
assertTrue("Should have deleted obsolete file.", fpFile.toFile().exists());
assertThat(fpFile.toFile()., is(aReadableFile()));
timeline.author: MarkEWaite

timeline.bodyHTML:
Hamcrest assertion for easier diagnosis of failures?

Suggested change
assertFalse("Should have deleted obsolete file.", fpFile.toFile().exists());
assertThat(fpFile.toFile()., is(not(aReadableFile())));
assertFalse("Should have deleted obsolete file.", fpFile.toFile().exists());
timeline.author: MarkEWaite

replies.bodyText: @MarkEWaite IIUC the aReadableFile FileMatcher is present inside Hamcrest Version 2.0 onwards. However, we are using hamcrest-library version 1.3. Should I try upgrading it? Or should I implement a custom Matcher?
replies.author: stellargo

replies.bodyText: should be fine to give it a go at upgrading, I don't remember hitting issues upgrading it elsewhere
replies.author: timja

timeline.message: Upgraded Hamcrest to Version 2.2. Incorporated Hamcrest assertion for FingerprintCleanupThread tests.

timeline.body:
Wouldn't this be much nicer?

```suggestion
                    listener.getLogger().println(deletionBlockerFacet.getClass().getName() + " created on " + new Date(deletionBlockerFacet.getTimestamp()) + " blocked deletion of " + fingerprintFile);
```

(Assuming this is millis. Untested.)
timeline.bodyHTML:
Wouldn't this be much nicer?

Suggested change
listener.getLogger().println(deletionBlockerFacet.getClass().getName() + " created at timestamp: " + deletionBlockerFacet.getTimestamp() + " blocked deletion of " + fingerprintFile);
listener.getLogger().println(deletionBlockerFacet.getClass().getName() + " created on " + new Date(deletionBlockerFacet.getTimestamp()) + " blocked deletion of " + fingerprintFile);

(Assuming this is millis. Untested.)
timeline.author: daniel-beck

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
import hudson.model.listeners.SaveableListener;
timeline.author: daniel-beck

timeline.message: Added hamcrest version as a property

timeline.body: Would it make sense to assert log output here, given what this change does (at least "blocked deletion")?
